In this paper, we present MASCHInE -a novel model-agnostic and protograph-assisted approach for learning KGEs.
Embeddings learnt by these KGEMs demonstrated potential applicability in tasks such as LP [21].

This widespread assumption that KGEMs create a semantic representation of the underlying entities and relations (i.e., project similar entities closer than dissimilar ones) has been challenged recently [14].

The seminal translational model TransE [3] represents entities and relations as lowdimensional vectors and defines the relationship between a head, a relation, and a tail using a translation operation in the embedding space.

In this work, we propose an approach named MASCHInE that leverages RDF/S information in a model-agnostic way, making it applicable to arbitrary KGEMs.

In parallel, the widespread assumption that KGEMs actually create a semantic representation of the underlying entities and relations (e.g., project similar entities closer than dissimilar ones) has been challenged.

Related work is presented in Section 2. In Section 3, we detail our approach for building protographs and how they fit into our approach MAS-CHInE.
Most of the KGEMs subsequently proposed aim at addressing its limitations and improve the representation expressiveness of KGEs [21], such as DistMult [24], ComplEx [20], ConvE [8], and TuckER [1].
In this work, we propose an approach named MASCHInE that leverages RDF/S information in a model-agnostic way, making it applicable to arbitrary KGEMs.
Additionally, it would be worth exploring whether pre-training over protographs provides benefits compared to passing the relevant RDFS triples to the KGEM as part of the whole graph.

Another line of research that is less explored focuses on preprocessing graphs prior to encoding their components [5,18], rather than focusing on the representation capability of the KGEM itself.
Extensive experiments on various evaluation benchmarks demonstrate the soundness of this approach, which we call Modular and Agnostic SCHema-based Integration of protograph Embeddings (MASCHInE).
